Stephen.text: Apple releases an iPad Pro with a screen between 15.0 and 15.9999 inches which replaces the 11-inch model
Stephen.full-pick-text: Apple releases an iPad Pro with a screen between 15.0 and 15.9999 inches which replaces the 11-inch model
Stephen.notes: • Was originally just "15 inch" but a specific range was requested after Federico's pick was read.

Stephen.text: No Intel Macs are left on sale (as new) at the end of 2023
Stephen.full-pick-text: No Intel Macs are left on sale (as new) at the end of 2023
Stephen.notes: • "Does not include the refurbished or educational stores." Or, in other words, the Intel Mac Minis and Mac Pro are not sold as new anymore (and of course they don't introduce a new Intel Mac).

Stephen.text: WWDC 2023 follows the same format as WWDC 2022, with a small number of people invited in person
Stephen.full-pick-text: WWDC 2023 follows the same format as WWDC 2022, with a small number of people invited in person
Stephen.notes: • No convention center, no ticket lottery, just like in 2022.

Stephen.text: Apple announces a multi-device charger that looks a lot like AirPower, without designated charging targets
Stephen.full-pick-text: Apple announces a multi-device charger that looks a lot like AirPower, without designated charging targets
Stephen.notes: • Stephen came to the table with two picks: "Apple announces a multi-device charger that looks a lot like AirPower" and "The 15 Pro Max weighs within 10% of the 14 Pro Max's weight". Myke believed that a 10% margin on either side is too wide to be risky and also that the AirPower one is just a better risky pick with less math. Once it's settled to go with the AirPower one, Federico asks to clarify "looks like" and the pick is modified to specify a lack of charging targets.

Stephen.text: At least 1 new iPhone ships with USB-C
Stephen.full-pick-text: At least 1 new iPhone ships with USB-C

Stephen.text: The two Pro phones will have different camera features
Stephen.full-pick-text: The two Pro phones will have different camera features
Stephen.notes: • It is agreed not to quibble too much about the name "Pro" if there ends up being something like an Ultra phone.

Myke.notes:
• Seems inevitable but it might be a bit ahead of its time.
  • Ungraded: might just be the Pro phones, to advertise the improved transfer speeds.

Myke.text: Apple releases a larger MacBook Air
Myke.full-pick-text: Apple releases a larger MacBook Air

Myke.text: Apple shows off their headset in March, they announce developer tools at WWDC, then show it off again at an event in September. It ships to customers in October
Myke.full-pick-text: Apple shows off their headset in March, they announce developer tools at WWDC, then show it off again at an event in September. It ships to customers in October

Myke.text: Apple calls the new camera the "Magic Telephoto"
Myke.full-pick-text: Apple calls the new camera the "Magic Telephoto"
Myke.notes: • Myke thinks that "periscope" is a bad name for regular people and so Apple will pick something else, and to make it risky, he has made a specific guess at the branding. He also considered "Ultra Telephoto".

Myke.text: At least 1 iPhone gets a 3 nm processor
Myke.full-pick-text: At least 1 iPhone gets a 3 nm processor

Myke.text: At least 1 iPhone gets a camera with a more than 3x zoom
Myke.full-pick-text: At least 1 iPhone gets a camera with a more than 3x zoom

Federico.text: Apple releases a new Mac mini
Federico.full-pick-text: Apple releases a new Mac mini
Federico.notes: • Ungraded: Probably the same design but with an M2 chip. More Thunderbolt ports would be nice.

Federico.text: Apple will release its biggest iPad ever with a display of at least 16 inches...
Federico.full-pick-text: Apple will release its biggest iPad ever with a display of at least 16 inches. It won't be OLED, it'll have the front-facing camera on the landscape side, and two USB-C ports at least. It'll be called iPad Studio.
Federico.notes: • "... It won't be OLED, it'll have the front-facing camera on the landscape side, and two USB-C ports at least. It'll be called iPad Studio."

Federico.text: There will not be an iPhone 15 mini
Federico.full-pick-text: There will not be an iPhone 15 mini

Federico.text: At least 1 of the new iPhones will have a customizable "action" button instead of a traditional mute switch
Federico.full-pick-text: At least 1 of the new iPhones will have a customizable "action" button instead of a traditional mute switch
Federico.notes: • Again, the name doesn't have to be exactly right, it's the concept.

Federico.text: At least one of the new iPhones will support the new Qi 2 wireless charging standard...
Federico.full-pick-text: At least one of the new iPhones will support the new Qi 2 wireless charging standard, and "reverse wireless charging" for AirPods cases. MagSafe charging speed will also be raised from 15 watts
Federico.notes:
• "... and "reverse wireless charging" for AirPods cases. MagSafe charging speed will also be raised from 15 watts."
  • Originally didn't include the last sentence.
  • The previous rumors of reverse wireless charging didn't disqualify this pick since it's in combination with Qi 2 as well. It's pointed out that Qi 2 is basically just standardized MagSafe as well, but it's still allowed as they'll have to be specific about Qi 2 to count it. Stephen still thinks it lacks passion. Later, Federico sprinkled some passion on it after all by adding a charging wattage increase after all.

Federico.text: The Pro iPhones will use titanium instead of stainless steel for the chassis
Federico.full-pick-text: The Pro iPhones will use titanium instead of stainless steel for the chassis
